N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16ยง 310.1 - Authorization of uniform system of accounts for classes a and b

State Regulations
(a) The uniform system of accounts for gas
corporations (classes A and B) is hereby prescribed for every gas corporation
(as that term is defined in the Public Service Law) that has annual operating
revenues from gas operations of $1,000,000 or more, subject to the jurisdiction
of this commission; and every such gas corporation is hereby required, by not
later than January 1, 2000, to keep its records and accounts in conformity
therewith. (b) During the 12 months
following the date on which the uniform system of accounts becomes effective, any such gas corporation may, for purposes of comparison, keep on its books, in
addition to the accounts hereby prescribed, such portion or portions of its
present accounts as may be deemed desirable by any such corporation. (c) In prescribing this system of accounts, the commission does not commit itself to the approval or acceptance of any item
set out in any account for the purpose of fixing rates or in determining other
matters before the commission. (d) In the system of accounts, commission means the Public Service Commission of
the State of New York. Notes
